pageContext.claim: “So when I took office, trade -- we lost $807 billion that year on trade, think of it. $807 billion, nobody even knows what it is, what does that mean?”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. had a $566 billion trade deficit in 2017, when goods and services are counted. But Trump only counts trade in goods. Moreover, countries do not "lose" money on trade deficits.
